page.title: 20LIFE'S MOST IMPORTANT THINGS
page.content: Our children were asked to indicate the things they thought most important in life. Understandably, they chose such things as village life, farming with all its machinery and livestock, and power stations providing electricity for family, community and farming requirements. In some ways the choices made are surprising, in that many of our children spend much of their leisure time watching tele- vision, with all that that medium in 1985 can interest a young person, by way of goods, opportunities and wider horizons. Yet our children considered of greatest importance the things they knew well, in which they saw purpose and a future.
